__inputs.description: Time range for computing rps graphs with rate(). At the very minimum it should be two times the scrape interval.
__inputs.label: Rate time range
__inputs.name: PROMETHEUS_RATE_TIME_RANGE

description: Dashboard for Tarantool application and database server monitoring, based on grafonnet library.

panels.description:
Overview of Tarantool instances, observed by Prometheus job.

If instance row is *red*, it means Prometheus can't reach URI specified in targets or ran into error.
If instance row is *green*, it means instance is up and running and
Prometheus is successfully extracting metrics from it.
"Uptime" column shows time since instant start.

targets.expr:
up{job=~"$job"} * on(instance) group_left(alias) tnt_info_uptime{job=~"$job"} or
on(instance) label_replace(up{job=~"$job"}, "alias", "Not available", "instance", ".*")

panels.title: Cluster status overview

panels.description:
Count of running Tarantool instances, observed by Prometheus job.
If Prometheus can't reach URI specified in targets or ran into error, instance is not counted.

Overall value of memory used by Tarantool items and indexes (*arena_used* value).
If Tarantool instance is not available for Prometheus metrics extraction now, its contribution is not counted.

Overall value of memory available for Tarantool items and indexes allocation (*memtx_memory* or *quota_size* values).
If Tarantool instance is not available for Prometheus metrics extraction now, its contribution is not counted.

Overall rate of operations performed on Tarantool spaces (*select*, *insert*, *update* etc.).
If Tarantool instance is not available for Prometheus metrics extraction now, its contribution is not counted.
If `No data` displayed, check up your 'rate_time_range' variable.

Overall rate of requests processed on Tarantool instances (all methods and response codes).
If Tarantool instance is not available for Prometheus metrics extraction now, its contribution is not counted.
If `No data` displayed, check up your 'rate_time_range' variable.

Number of "warning" issues on each cluster instance.
Panel works with `cartridge >= 2.0.2`, `metrics >= 0.6.0`,
while `metrics >= 0.9.0` is recommended for per instance display.
"warning" issues includes high replication lag, replication long idle,
failover and switchover issues, clock issues, memory fragmentation,
configuration issues and alien members warnings.
panels.title: Cartridge warning issues

panels.description:
Number of "critical" issues on each cluster instance.
Panel works with `cartridge >= 2.0.2`, `metrics >= 0.6.0`,
while `metrics >= 0.9.0` is recommended for per instance display.
"critical" issues includes replication process critical fails and
running out of available memory.
panels.title: Cartridge critical issues

panels.description: Replication lag value for Tarantool instance.
panels.title: Tarantool replication lag

panels.description:
Requests, processed with success (code 2xx) on Tarantool's side.
Graph shows mean count per second.
If `No data` displayed for Prometheus panel,
check up your 'rate_time_range' variable.
panels.title: Success requests (code 2xx)

panels.description:
Requests, processed with 4xx error on Tarantool's side.
Graph shows mean count per second.
If `No data` displayed for Prometheus panel,
check up your 'rate_time_range' variable.
panels.title: Error requests (code 4xx)

panels.description:
Requests, processed with 5xx error on Tarantool's side.
Graph shows mean count per second.
If `No data` displayed for Prometheus panel,
check up your 'rate_time_range' variable.
panels.title: Error requests (code 5xx)

panels.description: 99th percentile of requests latency. Includes only requests processed with success (code 2xx) on Tarantool's side.
panels.title: Success requests latency (code 2xx)

panels.description: 99th percentile of requests latency. Includes only requests processed with 4xx error on Tarantool's side.
panels.title: Error requests latency (code 4xx)

panels.description: 99th percentile of requests latency. Includes only requests processed with 5xx error on Tarantool's side.
panels.title: Error requests latency (code 5xx)

panels.description:
Data received by instance from binary protocol connections.
Graph shows average bytes per second.
If `No data` displayed for Prometheus panel,
check up your 'rate_time_range' variable.
panels.title: Data received

panels.description:
Data sent by instance with binary protocol connections.
Graph shows average bytes per second.
If `No data` displayed for Prometheus panel,
check up your 'rate_time_range' variable.
panels.title: Data sent

panels.description:
Number of network requests this instance has handled.
Graph shows mean rps.
If `No data` displayed for Prometheus panel,
check up your 'rate_time_range' variable.
panels.title: Network requests handled

panels.description: Number of pending network requests.
panels.title: Network requests pending

panels.description: Number of current active network connections.
panels.title: Binary protocol connections

panels.content:
`quota_used_ratio` > 90%, `arena_used_ratio` > 90%, 50% < `items_used_ratio` < 90% – your memory is highly fragmented. See [docs](https://www.tarantool.io/en/doc/1.10/reference/reference_lua/box_slab/#lua-function.box.slab.info) for more info.

`quota_used_ratio` > 90%, `arena_used_ratio` > 90%, `items_used_ratio` > 90% – you are running out of memory. You should consider increasing Tarantool’s memory limit (*box.cfg.memtx_memory*).
panels.title: Slab allocator monitoring information

panels.description:
`quota_used_ratio` = `quota_used` / `quota_size`.

`quota_used` – used by slab allocator (for both tuple and index slabs).

`quota_size` – memory limit for slab allocator (as configured in the *memtx_memory* parameter).
panels.title: Used by slab allocator (quota_used_ratio)

panels.description:
`arena_used_ratio` = `arena_used` / `arena_size`.

`arena_used` – used for both tuples and indexes.

`arena_size` – allocated for both tuples and indexes.
panels.title: Used for tuples and indexes (arena_used_ratio)

panels.description:
`items_used_ratio` = `items_used` / `items_size`.

`items_used` – used only for tuples.

`items_size` – allocated only for tuples.
panels.title: Used for tuples (items_used_ratio)

panels.description: Memory used by slab allocator (for both tuple and index slabs).
panels.title: Used by slab allocator (quota_used)

panels.description: Memory used for both tuples and indexes.
panels.title: Used for tuples and indexes (arena_used)

panels.description: Memory used for only tuples.
panels.title: Used for tuples (items_used)

panels.description: Memory limit for slab allocator (as configured in the *memtx_memory* parameter).
panels.title: Slab allocator memory limit (quota_size)

panels.description: Memory allocated for both tuples and indexes by slab allocator.
panels.title: Allocated for tuples and indexes (arena_size)

panels.description: Memory allocated for only tuples by slab allocator.
panels.title: Allocated for tuples (items_size)

panels.description:
The amount of data stored in the `.run` files located in the `vinyl_dir` directory.
Panel works with `metrics >= 0.8.0`.
panels.title: Vinyl disk data

panels.description:
The amount of data stored in the `.index` files located in the `vinyl_dir` directory.
Panel works with `metrics >= 0.8.0`.
panels.title: Vinyl index data

panels.description:
The estimated average rate of taking dumps, bytes per second.
Initially, the rate value is 10 megabytes per second
and being recalculated depending on the the actual rate.
Only significant dumps that are larger than one megabyte
are used for the estimate.
Panel works with `metrics >= 0.8.0`.
panels.title: Vinyl regulator dump bandwidth

panels.description:
The actual average rate of performing the write operations, bytes per second.
The rate is calculated as a 5-second moving average.
If the metric value is gradually going down, this can indicate some disk issues.
Panel works with `metrics >= 0.8.0`.
panels.title: Vinyl regulator write rate

panels.description:
The write rate limit, bytes per second.
The regulator imposes the limit on transactions based on the observed dump/compaction performance.
If the metric value is down to approximately 100 Kbps,
this indicates issues with the disk or the scheduler.
Panel works with `metrics >= 0.8.0`.
panels.title: Vinyl regulator rate limit

panels.description:
The maximum amount of memory used for in-memory storing of a vinyl LSM tree.
When accessing this maximum, the dumping must occur.
For details, see https://www.tarantool.io/en/doc/latest/book/box/engines/#engines-algorithm-filling-lsm.
The value is slightly smaller than the amount of memory allocated for vinyl trees,
which is the `vinyl_memory` parameter.
Panel works with `metrics >= 0.8.0`.
panels.title: Vinyl regulator dump watermark

panels.description:
Average per second rate of commits (successful transaction ends).
It includes implicit commits: for example, any insert operation causes a commit
unless it is within a `box.begin()`–`box.commit()` block.
Panel works with `metrics >= 0.8.0`.
panels.title: Vinyl tx commit rate

panels.description:
Average per second rate of rollbacks (unsuccessful transaction ends).
This is not merely a count of explicit `box.rollback()` requests — it includes requests
that ended with errors.
Panel works with `metrics >= 0.8.0`.
panels.title: Vinyl tx rollback rate

panels.description:
Average per second rate of conflicts that caused transactions to roll back.
The ratio `tx conflicts` / `tx commits` above 5% indicates that vinyl is not healthy.
At this moment you’ll probably see a lot of other problems with vinyl.
Panel works with `metrics >= 0.8.0`.
panels.title: Vinyl tx conflict rate

panels.description:
Number of current read views, that is, transactions entered a read-only state
to avoid conflict temporarily.
If the value stays non-zero for a long time, it indicates of a memory leak.
Panel works with `metrics >= 0.8.0`.
panels.title: Vinyl read views

panels.description:
The number of the scheduler dump/compaction tasks in progress now.
Panel works with `metrics >= 0.8.0`.
panels.title: Vinyl scheduler tasks in progress

panels.description:
Scheduler dump/compaction tasks failed.
Average per second rate is shown.
Panel works with `metrics >= 0.8.0`.
panels.title: Vinyl scheduler failed tasks rate

panels.description:
Time spent by all worker threads performing dumps.
Average per second rate is shown.
Panel works with `metrics >= 0.8.0`.
panels.title: Vinyl scheduler dump time rate

panels.description:
Scheduler dumps completed average per second rate.
Panel works with `metrics >= 0.8.0`.
panels.title: Vinyl scheduler dump count rate

panels.description:
Panel works with `metrics >= 0.8.0`.
This is the average share of time
spent by instance process executing in user mode.
Metrics obtained using `getrusage()` call.
If `No data` displayed for Prometheus panel,
check up your 'rate_time_range' variable.
panels.title: CPU user time

panels.description:
Panel works with `metrics >= 0.8.0`.
This is the average share of time
spent by instance process executing in kernel mode.
Metrics obtained using `getrusage()` call.
If `No data` displayed for Prometheus panel,
check up your 'rate_time_range' variable.
panels.title: CPU system time

panels.description: Memory used for the Lua runtime. Lua memory is bounded by 2 GB per instance.
panels.title: Lua runtime

panels.description:
total count of SELECT requests to all instance spaces.
Graph shows average requests per second.
If `No data` displayed for Prometheus panel,

panels.description:
My custom component could have 3 statuses:
code 2 is OK, code 1 is suspended process, code 0 means issues in component.
panels.title: My custom component status

panels.description:
My custom component processes requests
and collects info on process to summary collector
'my_component_load_metric'.
panels.title: My custom component load

panels.description:
My custom component processes requests
and collects info on process to summary collector
'my_component_load_metric'.
panels.title: My custom component process

title: Tarantool dashboard
